sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Uncommon Svchost Command Line Parameter
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects instances of svchost.exe running with an unusual or uncommon command line parameter by excluding known legitimate or common patterns.
This could point at a file masquerading as svchost, a process injection, or hollowing of a legitimate svchost instance.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Script Execution From Temp Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Base64 Encoded Invoke Keyword
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects UTF-8 and UTF-16 Base64 encoded powershell 'Invoke-' calls

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential PowerShell Command Line Obfuscation
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton (fp)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Weak or Abused Passwords In CLI
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects weak passwords or often abused passwords (seen used by threat actors) via the CLI.
An example would be a threat actor creating a new user via the net command and providing the password inline

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious PowerShell WindowStyle Option
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Powershell Create Scheduled Task
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows Task Scheduler to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Script Execution From Temp Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Base64 Encoded Invoke Keyword
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects UTF-8 and UTF-16 Base64 encoded powershell 'Invoke-' calls

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential PowerShell Command Line Obfuscation
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton (fp)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious LNK Command-Line Padding with Whitespace Characters
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects exploitation of LNK file command-line length discrepancy, where attackers hide malicious commands beyond the 260-character UI limit while the actual command-line argument field supports 4096 characters using whitespace padding (e.g., 0x20, 0x09-0x0D).
Adversaries insert non-printable whitespace characters (e.g., Line Feed \x0A, Carriage Return \x0D) to pad the visible section of the LNK file, pushing malicious commands past the UI-visible boundary.
The hidden payload, executed at runtime but invisible in Windows Explorer properties, enables stealthy execution and evasioncommonly used for social engineering attacks.
This rule flags suspicious use of such padding observed in real-world attacks.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Weak or Abused Passwords In CLI
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects weak passwords or often abused passwords (seen used by threat actors) via the CLI.
An example would be a threat actor creating a new user via the net command and providing the password inline

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious PowerShell WindowStyle Option
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Script Dropped Via PowerShell.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a PowerShell file (.ps1). While often times this behavior is benign, sometimes it can be a sign of a dropper script trying to achieve persistence.
